reviews.review_msg: Very helpful TA. Plus his English accent really helps :). You hang on to every word that comes out of his mouth. He is funny and innovative in tutorials..organizes games etc. Great at explaining things. One of the better TAs I've had at SFU.

Seems like a nice guy and knows his stuff, but unfortunately that doesn't really matter unless I learn the stuff properly. He just doesn't have very good notes and sometimes he's hard to follow.  It didn't help that Claydon taught the first 2/3 of the semester and his notes were great.

Worst instructor ever. Nice enough fellow but is completely unorganized, scrolls through pages of random notes and then tests on obscure numbers (no concepts) and irrelevant facts. You write 2 midterms worth about 30% and then your final is would the other 70% but he puts a guise on it calling it a combined midterm with 2 finals.

Lectures consist of him scrolling through pages and pages of unorganized notes. Midterms consist of complete memorization of pathways of some protein you spent 2 minutes of during day 6 for 30% of the mark. Memorize everything completely in your notes, do not learn anything, and you may do well in this class. May. But probably not.

*Cue Lennon's "Imagine"* Can you imagine if all the profs at SFU could teach like Claydon? Wow. Tution payments might actually be worth it.  The guy has crystal clear notes and actually answers questions people ask in class. Plus, he has a British accent, so it feels like you're studying at Oxford or something. Sign this guy to an extension.
The best prof I've had so far at SFU! He's very helpful during office hours and has great notes! Love him!
Absolutely amazing prof.  His notes were very clear and he was also willing to help.
Really hard class with a really hard professor. His notes are organized by he tests on every little details. Make sure you ready and understand and memorized everything on the notes.

Great professor, great conveyer of information, but extremely harsh marker. Unfortunately because of this memorization is a better way to go than actually learning because you'll lose marks if you aren't writing the exact words out of the slides.

She knows her stuff! Come to class and memorize every detail and know all the pathways and components. Easy enough if you have plenty of time on your hands. Be prepared to know the notes inside and out.
She's a great prof who is really helpful during her office hours, but her expectations for exams are very high. Anticipate lots of integrated questions and include detail!!

awesome prof!! he started the game "who wants to be a physiologist" to encourage kids to come to class. this is the first semester i've NEVER missed a single lecture...and i've done about 10% higher than my avg grade (just by even coming to class). yeah he will stumble in late sometimes, but c'mon it's 9:30 AM! He just really likes DETAILS!

Most useless frustrating prof in the entire history of profs. His slides are wrong all the time, he's always late and unorganized, and if you ask him a question he will never know the answer, but he may try to make something up so be careful. I think it was a joke for everyone in the class, it almost amused us.

Most rediculous prof ever! I don't know how many lecture slides and midterm questions had errors in them. He is so unorganized and cannot convey lecture material so that it can be understood. He should stick entirely to research. To get a good grade you MUST read the textbook as his notes don't make sense.

Great person. Horrible teacher. We would constantly have to correct him on what he said or wrote in class. He can't explain himself out of a box. Every lecture seemed rushed and muddled. The textbook was more helpful. Avoid Dr.White and try and take KIN305 w/Dr.Walsh (who was a guest lec while Dr.White was away...thank goodness).

He's never sure of what he's saying and there are TONS of mistakes in his notes all the time.  I've never met someone else so scattered. how does he get dressed in the morning.  aside from that, he's a good guy and tries hard to help.  But his notes suck cause they are so convoluted and too point form. reading textbook is a must.
she puts a lot of effort in to teaching. there is just so much material to know in this class, but u will really learn alot
